Description.div:
Only applicable for published data of Delete Order event, which can be raised by the deleteOrder API. Action =
DELETE
will be published to indicate that the order will be deleted.
The date that will be used for pricing the order.

Indicates if the billing, shipping, payment, tax, and currency information on the order should be defaulted from the customer information. When the flag is set to "Y", and a valid customer is found, the billing, shipping, and tax information on the order will be defaulted either from the customer or from the customer contact. The payment method on the order will only be defaulted if there is no payment method on the order. The currency will only be defaulted if the customer's IsDefaultCurrency is set to 'Y'.
Default:
N
Valid Values:
Y
or
N

Attribute.Name: DriverDate
Attribute.Description: Date used to driver order processing. '01' represents ReqShipDate, '02' represents ReqDeliveryDate.

Description.div: The channel through which this order was created. If the value of EntryType on the order matches the value of the common code Entry_Type, the common code's attributes are considered during order validation.

Indicates if this order has chained or related lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any delivery lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: HasPendingChanges
Attribute.Description: If order has pending changes then this flag will be returned as "Y".

Description.div:
Indicates if the order has any product lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any service lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

This flag determines whether an hold has been placed on the order when certain hold types criteria are met. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. The flag is reset to 'N' when all the hold types have been resolved on the order and all of its order lines. Based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. Note that there is no validation made on the hold applied but this flag can be reset by the application based on hold types existed on the order.
Default:
N
Valid Values:
Y
or
N

This flag indicates whether the expiration date is a system recommended date or whether it is already determined for the buyer. The value is Y if expiration date is system recommended. This flag only applies to Quotes.

Attribute.Name: MaxOrderStatus
Attribute.Description: Maximum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MaxOrderStatusDesc
Attribute.Description: Description of maximum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MinOrderStatus
Attribute.Description: Minimum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MinOrderStatusDesc
Attribute.Description: Description of minimum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MultipleStatusesExist
Attribute.Description: If order is in more than one status then this flag will be returned as "Y".

Attribute.Name: NegotiationStatus
Attribute.Description: Negotiation Status

Attribute.Name: NegotiationStatusDesc
Attribute.Description: Negotiation Status Description

Attribute.Name: OpenBookAmount
Attribute.Description: The amount that hasn't yet been paid by the customer. There may be charges existing to handle some of this amount.

Attribute.Name: OverallStatus
Attribute.Description: A description of the order's overall status determined by the YFSGetOverallStatusUE.

Attribute.Name: PendingChangesUserID
Attribute.Description: This attribute indicates user, who performed pending changes on the order.

Attribute.Name: ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder
Attribute.Description: Indicates that payment methods should be copied onto the return order and that refunds should be processed there, as opposed to the original sales order. This is only valid for return orders.

Description.div: The User Group of the user who created the order.

Attribute.Name: ScacAndService
Attribute.Description: Value of SCAC and Service code.

Attribute.Name: ScacAndServiceKey
Attribute.Description: Link to YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE table.

Attribute.Name: SourcingClassification
Attribute.Description: This attribute will be used to determine node for sourcing.

Attribute.Name: Status
Attribute.Description: Status of the order.

Description.div:
Indicates if data should be retrieved from the history table rather than the regular table.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
All charges of this order or it's return and exhange orders with type CHARGE or any charges of type TRANSFER_OUT that are transfering to an order with purpose REFUND.

Attribute.Name: TransactionDate
Attribute.Description: The last time this charge transaction detail was updated.

Attribute.Name: AuthAvs
Attribute.Description: AVS Autorization code.

Attribute.Name: RequestId
Attribute.Description: Authorization request Id.

Attribute.Name: AwaitingAuthInterfaceAmount
Attribute.Description: The total authorization amount that has not been sent to the payment processing system for processing yet.

Attribute.Name: AwaitingChargeInterfaceAmount
Attribute.Description: The total charge amount that has not been sent to the payment processing system for processing yet.

Attribute.Name: DisplayPrimaryAccountNo
Attribute.Description: The appropriate display value of the primary identifier of this PaymentType, depending upon the PaymentTypeGroup.

Description.div: The funds available to be charged on this payment method as determined by the YFSGetFundsAvailableUE user exit, if it was invoked. If the order is created for a customer and the payment method is a valid customer payment method, it indicates the amount available for the customer account. If customer account is not maintained internally or if the MaxChargeLimit is not set on the customer payment method, this value is returned as 0.
Indicates if the YFSGetFundsAvailableUE user exit was invoked for this payment method.

Attribute.Name: PrimaryAccountNo
Attribute.Description: The appropriate primary identifier of this PaymentType, depending upon the PaymentTypeGroup.

Attribute.Name: RequestedAuthAmount
Attribute.Description: The total amount of authorizations sent to an external system and still awaiting response on this payment method.

Attribute.Name: RequestedChargeAmount
Attribute.Description: The total amount of charges sent to an external system and still awaiting response on this payment method.

Attribute.Name: RequestedRefundAmount
Attribute.Description: The total amount of refunds sent to an external system and still awaiting response on this payment method. This number will be positive. This total will no longer be included in the RequestedChargeAmount, but if an asynchronous refund is submitted in excess of this amount, the RequestedChargeAmount will be reduced for backwards compatibility.

Attribute.Name: DriverDate
Attribute.Description: Date used to driver order processing. '01' represents ReqShipDate, '02' represents ReqDeliveryDate.

Description.div:
Indicates if this order has chained or related lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any delivery lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any product lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any service lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use pre 7.1 functionality, set the rule 'Use pre 7.1 hold Functionality'. If it is used pre 7.1 mode, it will indicate if order is on hold. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has any hold types. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and on all order lines. In this mode based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. This flag should not be passed when rule is configured to use 7.1 functionality. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: MaxOrderStatus
Attribute.Description: Maximum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MaxOrderStatusDesc
Attribute.Description: Description of maximum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MinOrderStatus
Attribute.Description: Minimum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MinOrderStatusDesc
Attribute.Description: Description of minimum order status based on all records that belong to an order.

Attribute.Name: MultipleStatusesExist
Attribute.Description: If order is in more than one status then this flag will be returned as "Y".

Attribute.Name: ProcessPaymentOnReturnOrder
Attribute.Description: Indicates that payment methods should be copied onto the return order and that refunds should be processed there, as opposed to the original sales order. This is only valid for return orders.

Attribute.Name: ScacAndService
Attribute.Description: Value of SCAC and Service code.

Attribute.Name: ScacAndServiceKey
Attribute.Description: Link to YFS_SCAC_AND_SERVICE table.

Attribute.Name: Status
Attribute.Description: Status description of the order.

Description.div:
Indicates if data should be retrieved from the history table rather than the regular table.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
The order to which these funds were transferred. This information is only valid for charge transactions where ChargeType is TRANSFER_OUT

Attribute.Name: DriverDate
Attribute.Description: Date used to driver order processing. '01' represents ReqShipDate, '02' represents ReqDeliveryDate.

Indicates if this order has chained or related lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any product lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Indicates if the order has any service lines.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use pre 7.1 functionality, set the rule 'Use pre 7.1 hold Functionality'. If it is used pre 7.1 mode, it will indicate if order is on hold. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has any hold types. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and on all order lines. In this mode based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. This flag should not be passed when rule is configured to use 7.1 functionality. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N

Attribute.Name: Status

Description.div:
Indicates if data should be retrieved from the history table rather than the regular table.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
The order from which these funds were transferred. This information is only valid for charge transactions where ChargeType is TRANSFER_IN.
All charges of this order or it's return and exhange orders with type TRANSFER_IN or any charges of type TRANSFER_OUT that are not transfering to an order with purpose REFUND.

This attribute is deprecated as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.1. If you want to use pre 7.1 functionality, set the rule 'Use pre 7.1 hold Functionality'. If it is used pre 7.1 mode, it will indicate if order is on hold. If order is on hold, default configuration will stop the shceduling and release process for the order. If the rule is not set, this flag is set/reset by the application. Application sets HoldFlag to 'Y' if order has any hold types or any order line has hold types. Flag is reset to 'N' if there are no hold types on order and on all order lines. In this mode based on hold type configuration, certain transactions may not be allowed to process. This flag should not be passed when rule is configured to use 7.1 functionality. There are no validations for this but value can be reset by the application based on hold types on order.
Default: N
Valid Values: Y or N
